We're working on more stories right now

                                            By 
                                                    POLITICO Magazine


                                            By 
                                                    Jeff Greenfield


                                            By 
                                                    Matt Latimer


                                            By 
                                                    POLITICO Magazine


                Getty

            By 
Nick Gass

10/14/15 03:45 PM EDT
Donald Trump promoted the latest book from Roger Stone, a longtime adviser on Wednesday, one that promises explosive, but highly dubious, revelations about both Bill and Hillary Clinton.
Stone's new book released Tuesday, "The Clintons' War on Women," alleges, among other things, that Hillary and Bill Clinton both went to lengths to cover up multiple instances of Bill Clinton's past sexual assaults on women in Arkansas and while he studied at Oxford.
Story Continued Below
“They dismissed them as bimbos, sluts, trailer trash, ‘who's going to believe these women,’ she says, ‘they’re nobody,'" Stone said on Sean Hannity's radio program Tuesday.
"The latest book on Hillary—Wow, a really tough one!" Trump tweeted Wednesday, including a link to its Amazon page.
Past tweets from Stone, a former aide to President Richard Nixon, have suggested he believes that Vice President Lyndon B. Johnson had a hand in the assassination of President John F. Kennedy (he wrote a 2013 book on the conspiracy), that Chelsea Clinton is not Bill Clinton's biological daughter ("I think we make a very strong case," he told Hannity), and that presidents Clinton and George H.W. Bush "trafficked millions worth of cocaine" through Mena, Arkansas, among other theories.
"I have hired personal security," Stone tweeted Oct. 7. In his interview with Hannity, he was more direct about the threat he perceived: “If in a couple of weeks they tell you I was depressed and I committed suicide, it’s a lie."
A selection of his recent tweets:
Told you so - scholar says LBJ killed JFK http://t.co/lFzgRGvLrp pic.twitter.com/aNFXPJvphs
— Roger Stone (@RogerJStoneJr) October 14, 2015
HUGE Scandal - Chelsea isn't Bill Clinton's Daughter? - The Political Insider http://t.co/LYEcsC4LQj
— Roger Stone (@RogerJStoneJr) October 13, 2015
.@billclinton exposed as a serial rapist and @HillaryClinton his enabler - Oct 13 http://t.co/FzaSNmGPaH pic.twitter.com/tBCe1dEgU0
— Roger Stone (@RogerJStoneJr) October 12, 2015

.@billclinton was tossed out of Oxford for raping a 19 year old http://t.co/LAe9oqCs0y pic.twitter.com/ZypV1uewTG
— Roger Stone (@RogerJStoneJr) October 12, 2015
Trump's the One ! @realDonaldTrump #Trump2016 It's #YUGE pic.twitter.com/9WUKOzC8aT
— Roger Stone (@RogerJStoneJr) October 13, 2015
These two trafficked millions worth of cocaine thru Mena Arkansas it's detailed in http://t.co/8uGDxK7xyK pic.twitter.com/psYN2ipfPd
— Roger Stone (@RogerJStoneJr) October 11, 2015
Webb Hubbell's daughter @ChelseaClinton before and after plastic surgery to conceal this truth pic.twitter.com/eHMyg79X1h
— Roger Stone (@RogerJStoneJr) October 9, 2015
I have hired personal security- my book exposing the criminality of the Clintons out Oct 13- http://t.co/LAe9oqCs0y pic.twitter.com/VJFwXjVNyi
— Roger Stone (@RogerJStoneJr) October 7, 2015
Stone had previously advised Trump's campaign until early August, when the two parted ways amid disputed circumstances. But Stone, who has been a fierce supporter of Trump on Twitter and elsewhere in the media, said that his former boss probably hadn't read his book.
"Book has been out 24 hours so I doubt he has had time to read it — he is kinda busy being the FRONTRUNNER for president," Stone said in email to POLITICO. "Donald and I have been friends for 30 years — he knows I am both meticulous in my research and relentless in expressing my point of view as well as being politically incorrect and fearless."
"I suspect Trump will like my next book, Jeb and the Bush Crime Family, even more," he added, referring to his upcoming work set for release on Jan. 19.
Neither the Trump campaign nor the Clinton campaign responded to requests for comment.
 © 2015 POLITICO LLC
title: Trump embraces sensational anti-Clinton book by former aide Roger Stone
